name: TheAtlantic
text: John Kerry "has the stature and ability to redefine America’s climate diplomacy, which the country sorely needs, but he will succeed only if his role is integrated into a broader strategy and doesn’t contradict or undermine it," @thomaswright08 writes: https://t.co/g3OA4Bjewr

name: TheAtlantic
text: Justin Sullivan, a staff photographer with Getty Images, covered nearly the full spectrum of U.S. news stories in 2020: the early days of the pandemic, protests, wildfires, and the election. Stories brought to us through his lens, via @theAtlPhoto: https://t.co/D9t528UZW3 https://t.co/LORIXGuX79

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The intertwined tales of Taft and Nixon help explain why, after two centuries, we are still so vulnerable to bad pardons, a power that the Framers left unchecked," @TimNaftali writes: https://t.co/aIMw8IQepJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: A refreshingly silly and airy adventure focused on the emotions of one character, “Wonder Woman 1984” is a charming end to a tiring year of cinema, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/T9LWjzicmx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Revisiting Shakespeare’s dark exploration of the dissolution of family, friendship, personality, and nation has become part of my annual rhythm," @MLabberton writes: https://t.co/VPXayxZ5za
